page.title: 11E.Horsley S. College.
page.content: Horsley Towers is now an Electricity Staff College, but reference to the manor occurred in the Domesday Book. (It would have been well-known to travellers to Canterbury, owing to its proximity to the Pilgrims Way, immed- iately to the South of this area). The impressive flint gatehouse is now a privately-owned residence. The present house was built in the 1820s and has had a number of owners, inluding the Earls of Lovelace, Mr Tommy Sopwith the aircraft designer and a girls' school. It was bought by the Central Electricity Generating Board in 1939, huts were built in the grounds and used as a staff headquarters during the 1939/45 war. In 1949, the first course began in what is now an enlarged 90-bedroomed training and Conference Centre.
